symptoms: Spindle-shaped lesions on leaves with brown centers and gray margins. Lesions appear on leaf blades, leaf sheaths, nodes, and panicles. Severe infection causes leaf drying and panicle blast.
treatment_chemical: Tricyclazole 75% WP @ 0.6g/l or Isoprothiolane 40% EC @ 1.5ml/l or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray (5ml/l), proper drainage, avoid excess nitrogen, use resistant varieties like IR64, Swarna
dosage: 0.6g per liter of water, spray 2-3 times at 10-15 day intervals
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, maintain proper spacing, avoid excess nitrogen fertilizer, ensure good drainage, remove infected plant debris

symptoms: Small, circular to oval brown spots on leaves with yellow halos. Spots coalesce to form large patches. Affects grain quality and yield.
treatment_chemical: Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Neem seed kernel extract (5%), cow urine spray, proper field sanitation
dosage: 2g per liter of water, apply at boot stage and heading stage
prevention_tips: Use certified seeds, maintain proper plant spacing, avoid water stress, remove infected debris

symptoms: Oval or elliptical greenish-gray lesions on leaf sheaths near water level. Lesions enlarge and turn straw-colored with brown margins. Causes lodging.
treatment_chemical: Validamycin 3% L @ 2.5ml/l or Hexaconazole 5% EC @ 1ml/l
treatment_organic: Bordeaux mixture (1%), proper water management, avoid dense planting
dosage: 2.5ml per liter of water, spray when disease appears
prevention_tips: Maintain proper spacing, avoid waterlogging, use resistant varieties, remove infected stubbles

symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaf margins that turn yellow and then white. Lesions extend along leaf veins. Yellow bacterial ooze appears.
treatment_chemical: Streptocycline 100ppm + Copper oxychloride 0.3% or Kasugamycin 2% + Copper hydroxide
treatment_organic: Garlic extract (5%), neem oil spray, proper drainage
dosage: 100g streptocycline + 1.5kg copper oxychloride per hectare
prevention_tips: Use disease-free seeds, avoid overhead irrigation, maintain proper spacing, remove infected plants

symptoms: Individual grains transform into greenish-yellow or orange spore balls. Spore balls are covered with powdery spores. Reduces grain quality.
treatment_chemical: Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Tebuconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray, proper field hygiene, use resistant varieties
dosage: 0.5ml per liter of water, spray at boot stage and heading stage
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, avoid excess nitrogen, maintain proper spacing, remove infected panicles

symptoms: Stunted growth, yellow-orange discoloration of leaves, reduced tillering. Leaves show mottling and yellowing. Panicles are small and sterile.
treatment_chemical: No effective chemical control. Use resistant varieties and vector control.
treatment_organic: Remove infected plants, control green leafhoppers (vectors), use resistant varieties like IR50, IR64
dosage: N/A - Focus on prevention
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, control green leafhoppers, remove infected plants, avoid late planting

symptoms: Black lesions on leaf sheaths near water level. Lesions enlarge and cause stem rot. Plants become weak and lodge easily.
treatment_chemical: Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Proper water management, avoid waterlogging, remove infected stubbles
dosage: 0.5g per liter of water, apply at tillering and booting stage
prevention_tips: Maintain proper water level, avoid waterlogging, use resistant varieties, remove infected debris

symptoms: Zebra-like stripes on leaves, leaf tips dry up, white to gray lesions with dark margins. Affects photosynthesis.
treatment_chemical: Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Tebuconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray, proper nutrition, avoid excess nitrogen
dosage: 0.5ml per liter of water, spray 2-3 times
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, maintain balanced nutrition, avoid excess nitrogen, proper field hygiene

symptoms: Discolored grains with brown, black, or pink spots. Grains become chalky and lose quality. Reduces market value.
treatment_chemical: Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l at heading stage
treatment_organic: Proper field hygiene, timely harvesting, avoid excess moisture
dosage: 0.5ml per liter of water, spray at heading and grain filling stage
prevention_tips: Timely harvesting, proper storage, avoid excess moisture, use resistant varieties

symptoms: Infected panicles remain enclosed in leaf sheath, fail to emerge. Panicles are twisted and malformed. Complete crop failure in severe cases.
treatment_chemical: Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Use disease-free seeds, seed treatment with hot water (52°C for 10 minutes), remove infected plants
dosage: 0.5g per liter of water, spray at boot stage
prevention_tips: Use certified disease-free seeds, seed treatment, remove infected plants, crop rotation

symptoms: Orange to brown pustules on leaves, stems, and heads. Pustules rupture to release powdery spores. Causes premature leaf death.
treatment_chemical: Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Tebuconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/l
treatment_organic: Use resistant varieties, proper crop rotation, avoid excess nitrogen
dosage: 0.5ml per liter of water, spray 2-3 times at 15-day intervals
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties like HD3086, PBW725, maintain proper spacing, avoid excess nitrogen, timely sowing

symptoms: Partial bunting of grains. Infected grains have fishy odor. Grains are partially or completely replaced by black powdery spores.
treatment_chemical: Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l at boot stage
treatment_organic: Seed treatment with hot water (52°C for 10 minutes), use disease-free seeds
dosage: 0.5g per liter of water, spray at boot stage
prevention_tips: Use certified disease-free seeds, seed treatment, avoid late sowing, proper crop rotation

symptoms: Entire head is replaced by black powdery spores. Spores are released leaving only the rachis. Complete loss of grain.
treatment_chemical: Seed treatment with Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg seed or Vitavax 75% WP @ 2g/kg seed
treatment_organic: Hot water treatment (52°C for 11 minutes), solar treatment, use disease-free seeds
dosage: 2g per kg of seed for seed treatment
prevention_tips: Seed treatment is essential, use certified seeds, avoid using infected seeds, crop rotation

symptoms: Long black streaks on leaves, leaf sheaths, and stems. Streaks rupture to release black spores. Plants are stunted.
treatment_chemical: Seed treatment with Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg seed or Vitavax 75% WP @ 2g/kg seed
treatment_organic: Hot water treatment, use resistant varieties, proper crop rotation
dosage: 2g per kg of seed for seed treatment
prevention_tips: Seed treatment, use resistant varieties, avoid late sowing, proper crop rotation

symptoms: White powdery growth on leaves, stems, and heads. Affected parts turn yellow and dry. Reduces photosynthesis and yield.
treatment_chemical: Sulfur 80% WP @ 2g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Tebuconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray (5ml/l), proper spacing, avoid excess nitrogen
dosage: 2g per liter of water, spray when disease appears
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, maintain proper spacing, avoid excess nitrogen, timely sowing

symptoms: Brown to dark brown lesions on leaves with yellow halos. Lesions coalesce to form large patches. Leaves dry up prematurely.
treatment_chemical: Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray, proper field hygiene, use resistant varieties
dosage: 2g per liter of water, spray 2-3 times at 15-day intervals
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, maintain proper spacing, avoid excess moisture, remove infected debris

symptoms: Dark brown to black lesions on stem base. Plants become weak and lodge easily. Roots may rot. Causes premature death.
treatment_chemical: Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l or Thiram 75% WP @ 2g/l as seed treatment
treatment_organic: Seed treatment with Trichoderma, proper drainage, avoid waterlogging
dosage: 0.5g per liter of water or 2g per kg seed for seed treatment
prevention_tips: Seed treatment, proper drainage, avoid waterlogging, use resistant varieties, crop rotation

symptoms: Yellow to orange stripes on leaves arranged parallel to veins. Pustules rupture to release yellow spores. Causes severe yield loss.
treatment_chemical: Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Tebuconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/l
treatment_organic: Use resistant varieties, proper crop rotation, avoid excess nitrogen
dosage: 0.5ml per liter of water, spray 2-3 times at 15-day intervals
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties like HD3086, PBW725, timely sowing, avoid excess nitrogen, proper spacing

symptoms: Upward curling of leaves, vein thickening, stunted growth, reduced boll formation. Whiteflies transmit the virus.
treatment_chemical: No direct treatment. Control whiteflies with Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.3ml/l or Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 0.2g/l
treatment_organic: Use resistant varieties, control whiteflies with neem oil, yellow sticky traps, remove infected plants
dosage: 0.3ml per liter of water for whitefly control
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties like Bt cotton, control whiteflies, remove infected plants, avoid late planting

symptoms: Angular water-soaked lesions on leaves that turn brown. Lesions are bounded by veins. Affects bolls causing boll rot.
treatment_chemical: Streptocycline 100ppm + Copper oxychloride 0.3% or Kasugamycin 2% + Copper hydroxide
treatment_organic: Copper-based fungicides, neem oil spray, proper field hygiene
dosage: 100g streptocycline + 1.5kg copper oxychloride per hectare
prevention_tips: Use disease-free seeds, avoid overhead irrigation, maintain proper spacing, remove infected debris

symptoms: Yellowing and wilting of leaves starting from lower leaves. Vascular discoloration in stem. Plants die prematurely.
treatment_chemical: Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l as soil drench or seed treatment with Thiram 75% WP @ 2g/kg
treatment_organic: Use resistant varieties, seed treatment with Trichoderma, proper crop rotation, soil solarization
dosage: 0.5g per liter of water for soil drench or 2g per kg seed
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, seed treatment, proper crop rotation, avoid waterlogging, soil solarization

symptoms: Circular to irregular brown spots on leaves with concentric rings. Spots coalesce to form large patches. Causes defoliation.
treatment_chemical: Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l or Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 2g/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray, proper field hygiene, remove infected leaves
dosage: 2g per liter of water, spray 2-3 times at 15-day intervals
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, maintain proper spacing, avoid excess moisture, remove infected debris

symptoms: Yellowing and wilting of plants. Roots become brown and rot. Plants die suddenly. More common in waterlogged conditions.
treatment_chemical: Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/l as soil drench or Metalaxyl 35% WS @ 2g/kg seed
treatment_organic: Proper drainage, avoid waterlogging, seed treatment with Trichoderma, crop rotation
dosage: 0.5g per liter of water for soil drench or 2g per kg seed
prevention_tips: Proper drainage, avoid waterlogging, seed treatment, use resistant varieties, crop rotation

symptoms: Dark brown to black spots on leaves with concentric rings. Spots have target-like appearance. Affects fruits causing fruit rot.
treatment_chemical: Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/l or Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 2g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray, copper-based fungicides, proper spacing, remove infected leaves
dosage: 2g per liter of water, spray 2-3 times at 10-day intervals
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, maintain proper spacing, avoid overhead irrigation, remove infected debris

symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves that turn brown. White fungal growth on undersurface. Rapid spread in humid conditions. Complete crop loss possible.
treatment_chemical: Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP @ 2g/l or Cymoxanil 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP @ 2g/l
treatment_organic: Copper-based fungicides, proper spacing, avoid overhead irrigation, good ventilation
dosage: 2g per liter of water, spray immediately when disease appears, repeat every 7 days
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, avoid overhead irrigation, maintain proper spacing, good ventilation, remove infected plants

symptoms: Sudden wilting of plants without yellowing. Brown discoloration in vascular tissues. Plants die quickly. White bacterial ooze from cut stems.
treatment_chemical: Streptocycline 100ppm + Copper oxychloride 0.3% as soil drench or seed treatment
treatment_organic: Use resistant varieties, seed treatment, proper crop rotation, soil solarization, avoid waterlogging
dosage: 100g streptocycline + 1.5kg copper oxychloride per hectare
prevention_tips: Use resistant varieties, seed treatment, proper crop rotation, avoid waterlogging, soil solarization

symptoms: Mottling and mosaic patterns on leaves. Leaves become distorted and crinkled. Stunted growth. Reduced fruit size and quality.
treatment_chemical: No direct treatment. Control aphids with Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.3ml/l
treatment_organic: Use virus-free seeds, control aphids, remove infected plants, use resistant varieties
dosage: 0.3ml per liter of water for aphid control
prevention_tips: Use virus-free certified seeds, control aphids, remove infected plants, use resistant varieties, avoid handling plants when wet

symptoms: Water-soaked dark green to brown lesions on leaves. White fungal growth on undersurface. Rapid spread in cool, humid conditions. Complete crop destruction.
treatment_chemical: Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP @ 2g/l or Cymoxanil 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP @ 2g/l or Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 2g/l
treatment_organic: Copper-based fungicides, proper spacing, avoid overhead irrigation, use disease-free seed tubers
dosage: 2g per liter of water, spray immediately when disease appears, repeat every 7-10 days
prevention_tips: Use disease-free seed tubers, avoid overhead irrigation, maintain proper spacing, remove infected plants, good ventilation

symptoms: Dark brown to black spots on leaves with concentric rings. Target-like appearance. Affects tubers causing dry rot. Reduces yield and quality.
treatment_chemical: Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/l or Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 2g/l or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 0.5ml/l
treatment_organic: Neem oil spray, copper-based fungicides, proper spacing, remove infected leaves
dosage: 2g per liter of water, spray 2-3 times at 10-day intervals starting from 45 days after planting
prevention_tips: Use disease-free seed tubers, maintain proper spacing, avoid overhead irrigation, remove infected debris, proper crop rotation

symptoms: Black crusty patches on tuber surface. Patches are superficial but reduce market value. Affects seed quality. More common in storage.
treatment_chemical: Seed treatment with Thiram 75% WP @ 2g/kg or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg seed tubers
treatment_organic: Use disease-free seed tubers, proper storage conditions, crop rotation
dosage: 2g per kg of seed tubers for seed treatment
prevention_tips: Use disease-free seed tubers, seed treatment, proper storage conditions, crop rotation, avoid waterlogging
